meanings.definition: One who curbs or restrains something.
meanings.sent1: The curber held back the excited puppy from running into the street.
meanings.sent2: The teacher is a curber of unruly behavior in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The curber of the team's enthusiasm was the rainy weather that canceled the game.
meanings.sent4: Her calm demeanor acted as a curber on the escalating argument.
meanings.sent5: The strict rules served as a curber on the students' freedom during the field trip.

meanings.definition: A device used to curb or control a horse.
meanings.sent1: The metal curber was attached to the horse's bridle to prevent it from galloping too fast.
meanings.sent2: The leather curber helped the rider maintain control during the horseback ride.
meanings.sent3: The old curber jingled softly as the horse trotted along the path.
meanings.sent4: The shiny curber gleamed in the sunlight as the horse trotted gracefully.
meanings.sent5: The sturdy curber kept the horse in check even when it wanted to run freely.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that limits or restricts something.
meanings.sent1: The strict curber of the company's budget prevented unnecessary spending.
meanings.sent2: Time can be a curber of our ambitions if we don't manage it wisely.
meanings.sent3: The curber of his dreams was his fear of failure, holding him back from pursuing them.
meanings.sent4: The mountain acted as a natural curber, blocking their path to the hidden valley.
meanings.sent5: The curber of her creativity was the lack of inspiration during the dry spell.
